answers.answer: _Dear Pat:I assume you wish a definition of severe preeclampsia with HELLP syndrome.Preeclampsia is pregnancy induced hypertension. The cardinal features of this condition of unknown etiology are elevated blood pressure, edema (swelling), and protein in the urine.Hemolysis, Elevated Liver enzymes, and Low Platelets (HELLP) are the collection of observations wherein the preeclampsia process causes red blood cells to break, liver function to decline, and platlets to be used up.Severe is a grading: mild, moderate, severe.Keywords: pre-eclampsia, HELLPThis information is provided for educaton purpose and is not a medical consultation. If you have specific questions, please speak with your physician.
